intro: Parvatia chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese mountain bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has lance-shaped leaves with rough textures. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice among gardeners and botanists alike.
